reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars the best dash cam i ever used
reviews.reviewText: the quality on the video this thing records makes it worth. and it comes with a back up camera. i have it recording all the time and i really like it. i move the videos to my pc once a week. great for incase of accidents or hit and run victims.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A compelling package for anyone looking to enhance their driving experience and security
reviews.reviewText: The Mrolik Store's 4K Dash Cam Front and Rear WiFi is a comprehensive solution for capturing every detail of your car journeys. With a focus on high-resolution recording and advanced features, this dash cam aims to provide a reliable and user-friendly experience.One of the standout features of this dash cam is its ability to record in 4K resolution at 60fps for the front camera, while the rear camera records at 1080p. This dual recording capability ensures that you capture clear and detailed video footage, whether it's the license plates or road signs during both day and night. The extra-large F/1.8 aperture and WDR/HDR contribute to exceptional night vision, enhancing visibility in low-light conditions.The integrated GPS tracking feature is a valuable addition, allowing you to record your driving route and speed accurately. This information can be crucial for providing evidence in case of accidents or disputes. The ability to connect to the "Ucam" app via WiFi provides convenient access to live streaming, video playback, and settings adjustments from your iOS or Android device.The dash cam offers a range of additional features, such as the G-sensor for collision detection, loop recording to prevent storage overflow, and parking mode for continuous recording with low power consumption. The inclusion of a free 64GB SD card is a nice touch, ensuring you have ample storage right out of the box.Installation is straightforward, and the compact design ensures it won't obstruct your view while driving. The ability to adjust settings like G-sensor sensitivity, loop recording duration, and parking mode settings allows for customization based on your preferences and driving habits.In terms of value for its price, the Mrolik 4K Dash Cam offers a comprehensive package of features that's on par with more expensive options on the market. The free 64GB SD card, included accessories, and reliable performance contribute to its overall value proposition.Comparing it to similar products, the Mrolik dash cam stands out with its comprehensive range of features, including 4K recording, WiFi connectivity, GPS tracking, and parking mode. While other dash cams might offer similar features individually, the Mrolik's combination makes it a well-rounded choice.One area for improvement could be the setup instructions, as some users might find certain aspects a bit complex. Additionally, the "Rearcam Mirror/Mirror Flip" feature might not be as intuitive as expected.In conclusion, the Mrolik Store's 4K Dash Cam Front and Rear WiFi offers a compelling package for anyone looking to enhance their driving experience and security. With its high-resolution recording, advanced features, and user-friendly interface, it's a reliable companion on the road that ensures you capture every detail of your journeys. The added benefit of continuous technical support and a 12-month warranty further enhances its value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use Dashcam
reviews.reviewText: I always wanted a dash cam just in case something happens and this dash cam has been very nice to have. The front dash cam is very simple to set up and connect with the app. The quality is pretty good and is nice to have as a piece of mind. However, the back dashcam is a lot more work and can even require some modifications to your car so I have not installed it yet. Everything feels well made and I have not run into any problems with recording or anything. Good relatively cheap dash cam.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Car Dash Cam
reviews.reviewText: This car dash camera works very well and has a good picture on the screen. The only issue was installing my truck was a little difficult hiding the wires.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Peace of mind!
reviews.reviewText: It’s a great starter cam system. If you’re looking for peace of mind, then a dashcam will certainly help. The picture quality is good and this camera definitely works as advertised. It was a little tricky to get set up (for a rookie who isn't particularly mechanically inclined) but once it was up and running, it has done well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with the dash cam! So easy to start up and get going. I feel safer knowing I can record what happens while driving. Great camera/picture quality and great value for the money!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Since I installed this in my car, I was in an accident. It was clearly not my fault but the other person blamed it on me. Thanks to this camera, I was deemed not at fault.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Parking Camera Requires Extra Work/Parts
reviews.reviewText: This is a pretty nice dash cam especially for the price. The fact that it has both front and back is great but keep in mind you do have to run a wire from the front of your vehicle to the back and that can be quite a pain to hide the wire.We got this for my husband's truck because my car already has a dash cam and I have found it very valuable for long trips (and short ones for that matter). The main issue we have with this is that it mentions that it has the option to run while parked which is a great idea, however, you need to have an extra kit to do this because you have to run a wire all the way to your battery in order to keep the camera working while the car is turned off. I'm not sure that part of it is worth the effort and we will likely not set it up but if that is something that appealed to you about this product note that you will have to take these extra steps.
Crystal clear and captures clear at night.

When considered as an entire package, this is a pretty good dashcam/rearcam combo that should suit most peoples' needs. The camera is fully featured with tons of neat stuff including an adjustable G-sensor (hard braking, impacts, whatever), time-lapse settings for when the car is parked, and of course, a generously-wide viewing angle on the front with the appropriate screen. Its overall size is compact so it won't get in the way or be obnoxiously distracting. The device comes with a 64GB card for storage, but the device can support up to 512GB.Managing the cameras is done via your phone or tablet through an app and by establishing a connection to the camera's local network. From the app, you can extract videos as desired. The physical display also has a handy physical button to snap photos on demand without having to open the app. Pretty much all of the available features are listed on the product page, so if it all appeals to you, then you're off to a good start.I found that the auto exposure adjustment was pretty good which is important for night driving (when you're most likely to get into an incident because of them unruly nighthawks) and the video quality was excellent. As far as features and functionality go, I was pretty impressed by this device.That said, a few things I didn't like which aren't necessarily dealbreakers, but definitely noteworthy. First, this thing runs hot. The page says it's supposed to run hot, but that doesn't mean I have to like it. It makes me worried about longer road trips, for example, or just the heat wearing the thing down in general. A heatsink would have gone a long way to solve this problem for a minimal cost, but alas. Second, the rear camera is hard wired, which is to be expected, but again, I am not a fan. Moreover, they suggest you run it through your car and drill holes into your trunk/hatch to hang the camera from above your plate. Perhaps if I still had my older rusty bucket, I wouldn't have minded, but my car is only a few years old; I'm not putting holes in it for anything or anyone! However, you can get creative and just point it out your back window instead and you'll be fine. Cable management is an issue, too. You're going to figure out how to deal with the two cables coming out of the display; one for the rear camera and one to reach your cigarette lighter power supply port. Moreover, they recommend even more wiring to make the most out of the parking settings. Meh.Overall, I like what's here and I am creative enough to work around its limitations. That said, I think there's too much expectation for you to make modifications to your car just to get this thing working as they recommend it - it's not necessary and you can definitely work around it, but the audacity to expect that this is something everyone will be okay with doing is just wrong. Also, it wouldn't have killed them to add a heat sink to the main unit. But either way, having this camera set is better than having none at all. Protect yourself and drive safe.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Channel with excellent recording quality. Happy interfaces fairly straightforward
reviews.reviewText: I recently got my hands on this new dash cam, and diving into its features has been a bit of a journey. At first glance, its compact size caught my attention. There was a moment of doubt, wondering if such a small device could deliver on its promises. But after setting it up and taking it for a spin, I discovered that the video quality was genuinely top-notch. Both daytime and nighttime recordings showcased clarity and detail that I hadn't anticipated. Especially during evening drives, I was pleasantly surprised by how well it adapted to changing light conditions, capturing crucial moments with precision.The user interface was intuitive, making the initial setup and any subsequent tweaks almost effortless. It felt like the device was designed with the user in mind, considering how quickly I could navigate through the settings. I also found out that the storage capacity was more generous than I had first assumed. The continuous loop recording feature meant I didn't need to worry about frequent manual deletions. It seamlessly overwrote older recordings, ensuring I always had the most recent footage at my disposal.One of the standout features was the automatic incident detection. During one of my drives, I had an unnervingly close encounter at a busy crossroad. Without any prompt, the dash cam instinctively saved that segment, providing a sense of security, knowing I had that clip safely stored should I ever need it.However, no product is without its flaws. While the video capture was commendable, the audio aspect had room for improvement. The built-in microphone managed to pick up conversations and sounds inside the vehicle adequately, but it struggled a bit when it came to external noises. Road sounds, other vehicles, and general ambient noises sometimes came across as muffled or distant. It's not a major downside, but for those who value crystal clear audio alongside video, it's a point worth noting.Considering it needs to stay plugged in, I had to be mindful of how I managed the cable. A neat installation ensured it didn't become an obstruction or distraction while driving. This, however, was a small trade-off for the peace of mind and functionality the dash cam offered.In wrapping up, my experience with this dash cam has left me mostly satisfied. It's a blend of impressive video quality, user-centric design, and some smart, thoughtful features. The few areas where it could use some enhancement are relatively minor when weighed against its strengths. It's a worthy companion for anyone looking to document their drives, whether for safety, accountability, or just capturing scenic routes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Your All-Seeing Eye on the Road
reviews.reviewText: The Car Camera Dash Cam Front and Rear is not just a dash cam; it's your vigilant road companion, capturing every moment in stunning 4K clarity and ensuring your safety with features like built-in GPS, Wi-Fi/app control, parking mode, G-sensor, and loop recording. With a 64GB SD card included, this dash cam provides comprehensive coverage and security for your journeys.Meticulously designed, this dash cam offers exceptional video quality. The 2160P front camera and 1080P rear camera capture sharp, clear footage, ensuring that you have visual evidence in case of any incidents on the road. The built-in GPS provides valuable location data, adding an extra layer of security and accountability.The Wi-Fi and app control functionality allow you to easily access and manage your dash cam's settings and recordings right from your smartphone. The parking mode ensures that your vehicle is protected even when you're not driving, and the G-sensor can detect and save video in case of sudden impacts or accidents.With loop recording, you won't have to worry about running out of storage space. Old recordings are automatically overwritten when the SD card is full, ensuring that you always have the most recent footage on hand.The Car Camera Dash Cam Front and Rear is more than just a dash cam—it's your personal safety and insurance on the road. Whether you're focused on capturing scenic drives, protecting yourself from accidents, or just want to have a record of your journeys, this dash cam ensures that you do so with clarity and confidence.In conclusion, the Car Camera Dash Cam Front and Rear is a top-tier dash cam that offers everything you need for a safe and secure driving experience. Its 4K resolution, built-in GPS, app control, and comprehensive recording features make it an essential addition to your vehicle. Whether you're prioritizing safety, convenience, or simply want to document your adventures, this dash cam guarantees that you do so with cutting-edge technology and peace of mind. If you're ready to enhance your driving experience, the Car Camera Dash Cam Front and Rear is the ultimate choice for your dash cam needs.

Front and Rear Cameras: This dashcam system includes both a front camera that records in stunning 4K resolution (2160P) and a rear camera that records in 1080P. This dual-camera setup provides comprehensive coverage of your surroundings and captures both the road ahead and what's happening behind your vehicle.WiFi and App Control: You can easily control and configure the dashcam using a dedicated app on your smartphone via a WiFi connection. This feature allows you to view and download footage, change settings, and manage your dashcam conveniently.Built-in GPS: The built-in GPS function records your vehicle's speed and location, which can be essential for tracking your routes, especially in the event of an incident or accident.64G SD Card Included: The package comes with a 64GB SD card, providing ample storage for your recorded videos. This ensures that you can capture and store a significant amount of footage without constantly worrying about storage space.Parking Mode: The parking mode feature enables the dashcam to continue monitoring your vehicle even when parked. It will automatically record if it detects any motion or impact, which can be crucial for capturing incidents that occur when your vehicle is unattended.G-Sensor: The G-sensor (gravity sensor) detects sudden changes in motion, such as hard braking or collisions. When triggered, the dashcam will lock and protect the current recording to prevent it from being overwritten.Loop Recording: Loop recording continuously records video in segments, overwriting the oldest footage with new recordings when the storage capacity is full. This ensures that you always have the most recent footage available.In summary, the Car Camera Dash Cam Front and Rear is a comprehensive and high-resolution dashcam system that offers a range of features, including WiFi and app control, built-in GPS, parking mode, and G-sensor, to enhance your driving safety and capture crucial footage while on the road.
